title: Strictly Dev and Dianne will learn the samba this week after exit
text:
Dianne and Dev had to say goodbye to the show in a shock exit (Picture: BBC)

Dev Griffin and Dianne Buswell are taking Strictly Come Dancing’s ‘keep dancing’ motto to heart.

Dianne, 30, has pledged to keep teaching Dev, 34, how to dance after their shock elimination last weekend.

The couple, affectionately nicknamed the Red Devils, were given the boot on Sunday night after landing in the bottom two with Viscountess Emma Weymouth and Aljaz Skorjanec.

But luckily, we’ll get to see more of Dev’s shaking hips – even if it’s not on BBC One.

Aussie dancer Dianne tweeted: ‘I’m going to teach dev a samba next week !!!! Keep and eye out on my you tube he deserves to show you guys more and that’s what We are gonna do.’

She even threw in a jab at the judging panel, adding: ‘You can be the judges this time 😊 #keepdancing #thatswhatwewilldo.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Fans were delighted with the announcement, with one person replying: ‘Awww I love that he still wants to dance’ and another writing: ‘Can’t wait to see it, he has such a natural talent for dance, he deserved to get to the final for sure.’

Dev was considered one of the favourites of the competition after his foxtrot, jive and street dance wowed the judges and viewers – with the latter, set to Friend Like Me from Aladdin, earned four 9s.

Dev and Dianne admitted they thought they were safe (Picture: BBC)

So people were pretty shocked and some downright furious when the DJ was eliminated in favour of Emma in the dance-off, following his and Dianne’s cha cha cha.

Some even cried ‘fix’ after claiming the phone lines were jammed when they tried to vote for Dev and Dianne – and slammed the judges’ ‘seriously odd’ scoring on Saturday which jeopardised the couple.

Speaking on It Takes Two, Dev said: ‘Every single week is so different, I don’t think you can ever take your position from the week before for granted. The scores don’t carry over.

‘When I woke up that day I didn’t think I’d be in the bottom two, but you can never tell, can you?’

Advertisement

Advertisement

When asked by Rylan Clark-Neal about how she felt when the light turned red, Dianne said she was ‘in a lot of shock’ and confessed: ‘I didn’t think that Dev would be in the bottom two for a while actually, if at all.

‘I think he did an amazing job on Saturday night and I thought his dance-off was even better.

‘I’m so proud of him, and just really upset that we were in the bottom two and we happened to leave the competition.’

Now, Kelvin Fletcher, Karim Zeroual, Emma Barton, Viscountess Emma Weymouth, Mike Bushell, David James, Michelle Visage Saffron Barker, Catherine Tyldesley, Will Bayley, Alex Scott and Chris Ramsey are left in the competition.

Strictly Come Dancing continues Saturday night on BBC One.

description: Dianne Buswell is teaching Dev Griffin the samba this week on her YouTube channel, despite their exit from Strictly Come Dancing.
